paper_abstract: The quantum computing scheme described in [1,2], when viewed as a cluster state computation, features a 3-D cluster state, novel adjustable strength error correction capable of correcting general errors through the correction of Z errors only, a threshold error rate approaching 1% and low overhead arbitrarily long-range logical gates. In this work, we review the scheme in detail framing the discussion solely in terms of the required 3-D cluster state and its stabilizers.
